newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-FAI's Adler sees solid 96/97 growth.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-FAI's Adler sees solid 96/97 growth.

text.p: The chief executive of FAI Insurances Ltd Rodney Adler said on Tuesday he saw solid growth for the company in the year to June 30, 1997.
"Our budgets are for a solid increase. I'm not talking two or three percent, it looks much better than that at this stage," Adler told Reuters in a telephone interview.
Adler said if the first half of 1996/97 was as encouraging as FAI thought it to be now, the company would be likely to pay higher dividends this financial year.
FAI earlier said its net result for the year to June 30 turned around to a profit of A$10.04 million from a loss of A$89.84 million in the previous year.

Adler said FAI, which has cash reserves of more than A$500 million, was continuing its search for acquisitions in Asia and Australia. "At the moment we have two companies which we are looking quite seriously at in Asia and have been for several months and we are doing due diligence," he said.
Adler said he did not think an announcement about either of these companies was imminent. He said the company was continuing its organic growth in Asia.
Adler said the company was happy to remain conservative with its investment policy of largely avoiding the equity market.
"I think the (equity) market has to have a correction of 10 percent minimum before any real change takes place," he said.

FAI was still in negotiations with two parties over its investment in the St Moritz Hotel in New York, Adler said. He said negotiations had broken down with a third party who had previously been the most active participant.
"It's a very large asset, it's well over A$200 million in value. It may be taking a long time but it need to take time to get the right deal," he said.
At 3.20 p.m. (0520 GMT), FAI shares were one cent weaker at 71 cents.
